page.title: 18LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: Prior to reorganisation in 1974,I was a member of the Newcastle Emlyn Rural District Council with its offices situated at Pontwelly, Llandysul. Members represented areas of Penboyr, Llangeler,Newcastle Emlyn,Llanybyther, Llanfihangel-Rhosycorn,Llancrwys, Cenarth and Llanfihangel ar Arth-the river Teifi forming a boundary between our Council and Ceredigion. Our Council had a great sense of Welshness and was proud of the great work achieved by its Housing and Environmental Committee.In 1970 I had the honour to be its Chairman. In 1974 reorganisation took place and we were amalgamated with the Carmarthen District Council with its spacious Headquarters at Carmarthen.This Council now embraces both farming and industrial areas.In 1979 I was made an Honorary Alderman.{MRS.M.B.WILLIAMS.
